page.title: 04Ashurst: 2
page.content: naturally belong to the rest of the area - over the river it is rather a part of the neighbouring small town of Henfield although with no communication these is no real or spiritual connection. The remainder of the 12 sq. km. block centres on the tiny parish of Ashurst but so small is the village that even before the boundary of the survey area has been reached 2km. to the south one has long been in Steyning parish and under its influence. To the north the next village lies 3 km. distant but although larger than Ashurst by an order of magnitude, its gravity, acting over the same distance as Steyning's, is not so great. (cont.)
